body_html:
All the mentioned APIs are merged into our core repository.
We also have haskell and rust bindings as external repositories, which are not mentioned in our website.
https://github.com/tensorflow/haskell
https://github.com/tensorflow/rust
The above are even owned by tensorflow github org, but not mentioned.
So I object these to be mentioned in the core API documentation. We should only list officially supported languages here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/

However, we have a lot of external contributions that we can point people to. Maybe we can have a section in api_docs landing page that is along these lines:
"""
Below are a list of languages that are supported by our commmunity.
Please reach out to repository owners for support and documentation:

-
"""
What do you think @wolffg @asimshankar

body:
All the mentioned APIs are merged into our core repository.
We also have haskell and rust bindings as external repositories, which are not mentioned in our website.
https://github.com/tensorflow/haskell
https://github.com/tensorflow/rust
The above are even owned by tensorflow github org, but not mentioned.
So I object these to be mentioned in the core API documentation. We should only list officially supported languages here:
https://www.tensorflow.org/api_docs/

However, we have a lot of external contributions that we can point people to. Maybe we can have a section in api_docs landing page that is along these lines:
"""
Below are a list of languages that are supported by our commmunity.
Please reach out to repository owners for support and documentation:

<language> - <website>
"""
What do you think @wolffg @asimshankar
